stories.title: Assist: Messi vs. NYC, 90+10′
stories.description: NYC’s tall task: Limit Leo’s playmaking, which they didn’t do in the season opener.

stories.title: Star of the Day: Denis Bouanga
stories.description: LAFC’s forward scores a hat trick to beat RSL and catch Leo in the Golden Boot race.

stories.title: Plays of the Day: September 7, 2025
stories.description: Relive sizzling highlights that lit up the pitch.

stories.title: Goal: Messi vs. SEA, 41′
stories.description: Locked in a tight Golden Boot race, Leo makes a run and taps in his 20th of the year.

stories.title: Goal: D. Bouanga vs. RSL, 88′
stories.description: Denis nets his 94th for LAFC to pass Vela as the Black & Gold’s all-time leading scorer.

stories.title: Hat Trick: S. Heung-Min vs. RSL
stories.description: Living up to the hype: Son scores two early and adds one late in a memorable win.

stories.title: Star of the Day: Idan Toklomati
stories.description: Against Messi and Co, the striker’s hat trick secures Charlotte’s ninth-straight win.

stories.title: Plays of the Day: September 13, 2025
stories.description: Relive sizzling highlights that lit up the pitch.

stories.title: T. Müller, 9.13.25
stories.description: The vibes are great in Vancouver and Thomas is ecstatic after a huge 7–0 win.

stories.title: Sebastian Sounds Off
stories.description: Vancouver’s midfielder chats about team chemistry and Müller’s birthday hat trick.

stories.title: Cloud Nine
stories.description: Experts go over Charlotte’s nine-game win streak and the key players to that run.

stories.title: Cincy Clinches
stories.description: Wrap-Up says FCC’s playoff-clinching win is a confidence boost the club needed.

stories.title: D. St. Clair, 9.13.25
stories.description: After his 12-save night, the keeper says Minny are capable of finishing atop the West.

stories.title: A Ref’s POV
stories.description: Innovation on the pitch: A referee dons a camera during LAFC’s win at Levi’s Stadium.

stories.title: Hat Trick: D. Bouanga vs. SJ, 9.13.25
stories.description: Denis takes over the Bay and ties Carlos Vela as LAFC’s all-time leading scorer.
